net.sf.gogui.gtp
Class GtpSynchronizer

java.lang.Object
  net.sf.gogui.gtp.GtpSynchronizer

public class GtpSynchronizer
extends java.lang.Object

Synchronizes a GTP engine with a Go board. Handles different capabilities of different engines. If GtpSynchronizer is used, no game state changing GTP commands (like clear_board, play, undo, komi, time_settings) should be sent to this engine outside this class.

Nested Class Summary
static interface GtpSynchronizer.Listener
          Callback that is called after each change in the engine's move number.

updateHumanMove

public void updateHumanMove(ConstBoard board,
                            Move move)
                     throws GtpError
Send human move to engine. The move is not played on the board yet. This function is useful, if it should be first tested, if the engine accepts a move, before playing it on the board, e.g. after a new human move was entered.

Throws:
GtpError

updateAfterGenmove

public void updateAfterGenmove(ConstBoard board)
Update internal state after genmove. Needs to be called after each genmove (or kgs-genmove_cleanup) command. The computer move is expected to be already played on the board, but does not need to be transmitted to the program anymore, because genmove already executes the move at the program's side.
